metadata.title: AliasVault
metadata.description: AliasVault is an open-source end-to-end encrypted password and alias manager.

hero.title: Privacy-First Password & Email Alias Manager
hero.description: AliasVault is an end-to-end encrypted password and (email) alias manager that protects your privacy by creating alternative identities, passwords and email addresses for every website you use.

footer.description: AliasVault is a privacy-first, open-source, end-to-end encrypted password and (email) alias manager that protects your privacy.

features.title: Features
features.subtitle: What makes AliasVault unique
features.description: AliasVault provides comprehensive privacy protection through innovative features designed to keep your digital identity secure.
features.pageDescription: Discover the powerful features that make AliasVault the ultimate solution for password and identity management.

legend.roadmapText: Track our progress and see what's coming next on our

passwordManager.title: Password Manager
passwordManager.description: AliasVault allows you to generate and store all your passwords in one place, and access them from any device (desktop, mobile, tablet).

aliasGenerator.title: Alias Generator
aliasGenerator.description: AliasVault allows you to generate unique aliases (identities) that you can use to sign up for different services, keeping your real identity hidden.

emailServer.title: Built-in Email Server
emailServer.description: AliasVault has its own built-in email server that allows you to create unique email addresses and receive emails straight in AliasVault. No third-party email service required.

encryption.title: End-To-End Encryption
encryption.description: Your data is fully encrypted on your local device before backed up online. Your master password is never transmitted to the server. No one, except you, can see inside your vault.

hosting.title: Cloud or self-hosted
hosting.description: You can use the official AliasVault cloud service, or self-host AliasVault on your own server or a cloud provider of your choice. Your data is in your control.

openSource.title: Free and Open-Source
openSource.description: AliasVault is free and open-source software. It is built with transparency in mind, and its source code is freely available on GitHub to review.

about.title: About AliasVault
about.subtitle: Privacy-first password management
about.description: Learn more about our mission to provide secure, private password and alias management.
about.pageDescription: AliasVault is an open-source end-to-end encrypted password and alias manager. With AliasVault you can create unique identities, passwords and email addresses for every website you use. Keeping you safe online.

sectionOne.title: Your privacy. Protected.
sectionOne.paragraph: In an ideal world you don't need AliasVault, in reality you do. Many companies track your online activity without your permission or knowledge, creating [shadowProfileLink]shadow profiles[/shadowProfileLink] of you. Even the most reputable companies can fall victim to [dataBreachLink]data breaches[/dataBreachLink], causing your personal information to fall into the wrong hands. AliasVault helps keep you safe online by letting you control how websites see and track you.

features.uniqueIdentity: Every website, a new alias, email address and password
features.dataTracking: When your data is shared, you know which service caused it
features.privacyControl: Only use your real identity and email address when it's absolutely necessary, keeping your private information private

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: Get in touch
contact.description: Have questions or need support? We're here to help.

content.intro: AliasVault is an open-source project founded and maintained by
content.location: and operates from the Netherlands. We offer an official cloud-hosted version, with our own dedicated servers located in Germany, fully compliant with European GDPR regulations.
content.inquiries: For inquiries regarding our cloud-hosted service, commercial licensing, or enterprise support, please contact:

support.title: Support & Bug Reports
support.description: For bug reports please use our GitHub repository. For technical discussions about the open-source project, join our Discord community:

faq.title: FAQ & Documentation
faq.description: Find answers to common questions in our FAQ, or find more information on our separate documentation website.

features.title: Feature Requests & Ideas
features.description: Have an idea for improving AliasVault? Submit feature requests through our GitHub Discussions. Please check if your suggestion has already been made and feel free to upvote existing requests you support. If you wish to get in contact with the author and maintainers instead, feel free to join our Discord community.

links.discuss: Discuss ideas on our Discord Community

donations.title: Donations
donations.description: If you find AliasVault useful, consider supporting its development through Buy Me A Coffee. Donations are optional but greatly appreciated and will help us continue to improve the project.

platforms.title: Platforms
platforms.subtitle: Available everywhere
platforms.description: AliasVault is available on all major platforms and browsers.
platforms.pageDescription: AliasVault is available on all major platforms, including web, desktop, and mobile.

mobileApps.title: Mobile Apps
mobileApps.description: AliasVault is available as a native iOS and Android app allowing you to manage and use your credentials and aliases on the go.

features.sync: Seamless sync across all your devices

browserExtensions.title: Browser Extensions
browserExtensions.description: AliasVault offers browser extensions that integrate seamlessly with your browsing experience, making it easy to manage your passwords and aliases directly from your browser.
browserExtensions.featuresTitle: Our browser extensions allow you to:

features.aliases: Generate new email aliases on the fly
features.access: Access your vault directly from your browser
features.save: Securely save new credentials as you browse

roadmap.title: Development Roadmap
roadmap.description: AliasVault is under active development, with a strong focus on usability, security, and cross-platform support. The main focus is on ensuring robust usability for everyday tasks, including comprehensive autofill capabilities across all platforms.

statusItems.production: â Production-ready with data integrity guarantees
statusItems.feedback: ð¥ Strong emphasis on user feedback and testing

roadmap.roadmapLink: To track our progress and see what's coming next, check out our

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common questions about AliasVault's features, security, and deployment options.

1.question: What is AliasVault and who is it for?
1.answer:
AliasVault is a password manager built with a strong focus on privacy, making it the ideal choice for privacy-conscious individuals.

AliasVault features a built-in email server that allows you to create unique email addresses (aliases) for different services. If you care about controlling your digital identity, preventing spam, and reducing your exposure in data breaches, AliasVault helps you manage credentials and aliases securely.

Fully open-source and transparent. No third-party dependencies.

2.question: How much does AliasVault cost?
2.answer:
The current core version of AliasVault, with all of its features, is completely free to use and will always remain that way. Both for the official cloud-hosted and self-hosted options. 

In the near future, we do plan to introduce optional premium features such as additional storage space, automatic back-ups, and more. These paid options will help support the continued development and costs of the project.

That said, we are currently focused on developing and refining the basic features of AliasVault to ensure a stable and reliable foundation for all users. Premium features are part of our longer-term roadmap, but our current priority is to deliver a solid core experience.

If you'd like to support the project in the meantime, we welcome donations â please visit our [contactLink]contact page[/contactLink] for more information.

3.question: Which devices are supported by AliasVault?
3.answer:
AliasVault works on all major platforms: web, desktop, and mobile.

You can access your vault through the AliasVault web app, browser extensions, or by downloading the mobile apps, ensuring you always have access to your vault no matter the device.

4.question: How does AliasVault protect my data?
4.answer:
Security is the foundation of AliasVault. End-to-end encryption (AES-256-GCM) is used to encrypt all your data. Everything, including usernames, passwords and even email contents, is encrypted on your device. Even on our servers, your information stays encrypted, protected by your master password, which only you know. Our strict zero-knowledge architecture guarantees that no one â not even us â can access your vault.

For in-depth technical details, visit our [docsLink]architecture documentation[/docsLink].

5.question: Can I import my passwords from other password managers?
5.answer:
Yes! AliasVault makes it easy to migrate your credentials from other password managers. We support importing from popular services including 1Password, Bitwarden, Chrome, Dashlane, Firefox, KeePass, KeePassXC, Proton Pass, and Strongbox.

Simply export your data from your current password manager and use AliasVault's import function in the web app to seamlessly transfer all your credentials, notes, 2FA codes and other data.

Plus, AliasVault also includes export functionality, so if you ever decide to switch to another service in the future, you can easily take your data with you. You have full control over your data.

6.question: Can I self-host AliasVault on my own server?
6.answer:
Yes, AliasVault is designed from the ground up to be fully self-hosted. You can easily deploy it on your own server using Docker, giving you complete control over your data and infrastructure. AliasVault comes with an automatic install script which makes installation a breeze.

Detailed installation instructions are available in our [docsLink]documentation[/docsLink].

7.question: How does the email alias feature work?
7.answer:
AliasVault includes a built-in email server that allows you to create unique email addresses (aliases) for different services.

When someone sends an email to your alias, it's received directly in AliasVault and immediately encrypted, helping you maintain privacy and reduce spam.

8.question: Are there limitations to using email aliases?
8.answer:
Currently there are two main restrictions:

1) Email aliases are receive-only, meaning you cannot send or reply to emails from your aliases. This measure prevents potential abuse of the system for spam.

2) There is a 10 megabyte size limit for incoming emails - any emails larger than this will be rejected.

In the future, optional paid subscriptions will lift these restrictions. Also, currently email storage has no limit but is based on fair-use. In the future specific limits may be introduced for the free tier, but will be announced in advance.

9.question: What's the story behind AliasVault?
9.answer:
AliasVault started as a side project in early 2024, driven by the belief that privacy is a right, not a luxury. It was created to make the internet a safer, more private place â where users are in control of their digital identity.

The creator of AliasVault, Leendert de Borst, has long been passionate about fighting spam and making privacy accessible. Back in 2013, he launched asdasd.nl, a Dutch temporary email service that over the years grew into the multilingual SpamOK.com, helping thousands of users shield themselves from spam and data collection.

AliasVault is the next step in that journey: a self-hostable, end-to-end encrypted password and alias manager that helps you generate unique email aliases and strong passwords for every service you use. By minimizing the personal information you share online, AliasVault helps you stay secure and anonymous.

Since the beta release in December 2024, AliasVault has seen steady bi-weekly updates, introducing new features like browser extensions, two-factor authentication, mobile apps and import support from other password managers â all designed to make privacy more powerful and accessible.

AliasVault is fully open-source and entirely self-funded. It's built to be transparent, community-driven, and privacy-first.

Learn more about [missionLink]our mission[/missionLink] and what drives this project.

video.title: AliasVault demo
video.description: Check out the video below to see AliasVault in action.

callToAction.title: Protect your privacy, improve your security
callToAction.description: Stop spam â¢ Protect your privacy â¢ Open source

founder.title: Story behind AliasVault
founder.subtitle: Meet the founder behind AliasVault and discover what drives our mission

story.paragraph1: As a software developer and architect, I've always been passionate about fighting spam and making privacy accessible. In 2013, I launched asdasd.nl, a Dutch temporary email service that grew into the multilingual SpamOK.com, helping thousands protect themselves from spam and data collection.
story.paragraph2: In 2024, I began building AliasVault. A self-hostable, end-to-end encrypted password and alias manager that puts users in control of their digital identity. It lets you generate unique passwords and email aliases for every site you use, keeping your personal data secure.
story.paragraph3: Since the beta release in December, I've continued to work on AliasVault with bi-weekly updates. New features like browser extensions, 2FA, and imports from other password managers make AliasVault more powerful and accessible with each release.
story.paragraph4: AliasVault is open source and as of right now, entirely self-funded. It's built to be transparent, community-driven, and privacy-first. Optional premium cloud features will support long-term development, but anyone can self-host it or inspect the code. Read more about
story.paragraph4End: to learn what drives this project.

metadata.title: Report Abuse
metadata.description: Report abuse of AliasVault email aliases.

reportAbuse.title: Report Abuse
reportAbuse.description: If you or your service (website, app, etc.) is negatively affected by an email alias from AliasVault, please contact us. We take abuse reports seriously and will investigate all legitimate claims.
reportAbuse.contactText: To report abuse, please contact us directly at
reportAbuse.responseTime: and include the email addresses that are part of the abuse. We will respond within 48 hours.

passwordManagement.title: Password Management
passwordManagement.description: Securely store, generate, and manage all your passwords in one place with AliasVault's powerful password management features.

passwordManager.name: Password Manager
passwordManager.description: Store all your passwords securely in one place, accessible from any device with industry leading end-to-end encryption.

adjustableGenerator.name: Adjustable Generator
adjustableGenerator.description: Create custom patterns, length, and character sets for your passwords to make them more secure. Customizable per credential.

builtIn2FA.name: Built-in 2FA Authenticator
builtIn2FA.description: Store and generate 2FA secrets for all your accounts directly in AliasVault.

passwordSharing.name: Password Sharing
passwordSharing.description: Securely share access to stored passwords with family members or team members.

emailAliases.title: Email Aliases
emailAliases.description: Create unique email addresses for different services to protect your primary email and reduce spam with AliasVault's built-in email server. No external dependencies.

builtInEmailServer.name: Built-in Email Server
builtInEmailServer.description: Create unique email addresses and receive emails directly in AliasVault without needing a third-party email service.

aliasGenerator.name: Alias Generator
aliasGenerator.description: Generate unique email addresses with full alias support including first name, last name, birth date and more.

customDomainsSelfHosted.name: Custom Domains (self-hosted)
customDomainsSelfHosted.description: Use your own domain for your email aliases in self-hosted setups.

customDomainsCloudHosted.name: Custom Domains (cloud-hosted)
customDomainsCloudHosted.description: Use email aliases with your own domain on the official cloud-hosted AliasVault server.

security.title: Security Features
security.description: AliasVault uses industry-standard encryption and security measures to protect your data.

endToEndEncryption.name: End-to-End Encryption
endToEndEncryption.description: All data is encrypted on your device before being backed up online. Your master password is never transmitted to the server.

twoFactorAuthentication.name: Two-Factor Authentication
twoFactorAuthentication.description: Add an extra layer of security to your vault with TOTP-based two-factor authentication.

biometricAuthentication.name: Biometric Authentication
biometricAuthentication.description: Unlock your vault using fingerprint or face recognition on supported devices via WebAuthn.

secureNotesAttachments.name: Secure Notes & Attachments
secureNotesAttachments.description: Store sensitive information like credit card details, secure notes, and other confidential data inside your vault.

browserExtensions.title: Browser Extensions
browserExtensions.description: Access your vault from anywhere with AliasVault's browser extensions.

availableForEveryBrowser.name: Available for every browser
availableForEveryBrowser.description: The AliasVault browser extension is officially available for Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari. Additional Chrome-based browsers are also supported such as Brave, Vivaldi and Opera.

autofillCredentials.name: Autofill Credentials
autofillCredentials.description: Seamlessly autofill (user)names and passwords while you browse.

emailAliasGenerator.name: Email Alias Generator
emailAliasGenerator.description: Generate (email) aliases directly from the browser extension with a simple click.

mobileApps.title: Mobile Apps
mobileApps.description: Access your vault from anywhere with AliasVault's mobile apps.

iosApp.name: iOS App
iosApp.description: Access your vault on your iPhone or iPad with the official iOS app. Supports native autofill and Face ID / Touch ID authentication, keeping your data secure.

androidApp.name: Android App
androidApp.description: Access your vault on your Android device with the official Android app. Supports native autofill and biometric authentication, keeping your data secure. Available on Google Play or as a manual APK via GitHub.

selfHosting.title: Self-hosting Support
selfHosting.description: Take full control of your data by self-hosting AliasVault on your own server or a cloud provider of your choice.

cloudOrSelfHosted.name: Cloud or Self-hosted
cloudOrSelfHosted.description: Use the official AliasVault cloud service for convenience or self-host on your own server for complete control of your data.

freeAndOpenSource.name: Free and Open-Source
freeAndOpenSource.description: Completely free and open-source software, with source code available on GitHub.

adminPanelLogs.name: Admin Panel & Logs
adminPanelLogs.description: Track all activities on your server with the built-in admin panel and audit logs.

familyTeamManagement.name: Family & Team Management
familyTeamManagement.description: Share vaults with family members and team members via organizational features.

metadata.title: Alternative to Bitwarden
metadata.description: AliasVault is an open-source end-to-end encrypted password and alias manager.

hero.title: Looking for a Bitwarden Alternative?
hero.description: AliasVault offers a secure, open-source solution for password management with integrated email alias features. Get all the security you love from Bitwarden, plus enhanced privacy features.

emailAlias.title: Integrated Email Alias Management
emailAlias.description: While Bitwarden excels at password management, AliasVault combines both password management and email alias capabilities in one secure platform. Create disposable email addresses on the fly while saving your passwords. No external email dependencies required.

identityGeneration.title: Advanced Identity Generation
identityGeneration.description: AliasVault goes beyond simple form filling by generating complete random identities for each alias. This includes names, birthdates, and other details, providing enhanced privacy when signing up for services.

selfHosting.title: Simplified Self-hosting
selfHosting.description: While both platforms offer self-hosting options, AliasVault provides a streamlined installation process with our easy installer. Get your private instance up and running in minutes, not hours.

limitations.title: Good to Know
limitations.description: In the spirit of transparency, here are some current limitations of AliasVault compared to Bitwarden:

age.title: Age:
age.description: Bitwarden has been around longer and has a larger user base, which means more community-tested features and integrations.

metadata.title: Alternative to SimpleLogin
metadata.description: AliasVault is an open-source end-to-end encrypted password and alias manager.

hero.title: Looking for a SimpleLogin Alternative?
hero.description: AliasVault offers a secure, open-source solution for email alias management with end-to-end encryption. Get all the features you love from SimpleLogin, plus enhanced privacy and security.

passwordManager.title: All-in-one password manager
passwordManager.description: AliasVault combines email alias management with a powerful password manager, providing a complete privacy solution in one secure platform. AliasVault has no external dependencies and as a cherry on top, you can also fully self-host it.

randomIdentities.title: Complete Random Identity Generation
randomIdentities.description: With AliasVault, each email alias comes with a complete randomly generated identity - including first name, last name, birthdate, and more. Using our browser extension, these identity details are automatically filled in forms, creating truly random alternative identities without any user input or bias. This ensures maximum privacy and convenience.

encryption.title: End-to-end encryption and full anonymity
encryption.description: Unlike SimpleLogin which requires your personal email in order to forward received emails in plain text, AliasVault provides true end-to-end encryption that encrypts all email contents as soon as its received which is then safely stored on the AliasVault server. No one can read your emails except you.

limitations.title: Good to Know
limitations.description: In the spirit of transparency, here are some current limitations of AliasVault compared to SimpleLogin:

emailResponses.title: Email Responses:
emailResponses.description: SimpleLogin allows users to respond to incoming emails, while AliasVault currently does not support this feature as part of our spam prevention strategy. We may introduce this capability in the future as part of a premium offering.

emailSizeLimit.title: Email Size Limit:
emailSizeLimit.description: AliasVault has a 10MB size limit for incoming emails. Any emails larger than this will be rejected.

metadata.title: Alternative to Proton Pass
metadata.description: AliasVault is a fully open-source end-to-end encrypted password and alias manager that can be self-hosted.

hero.title: Looking for a Proton Pass Alternative?
hero.description: AliasVault offers complete transparency with fully open-source code and self-hosting capabilities. Get the features you expect from Proton Pass, but with full control over your data and complete source code access.

comparison.title: Why Choose AliasVault over Proton Pass

openSource.title: Complete Open Source Transparency
openSource.description: While Proton Pass does open-source their client applications, their server code is actually proprietary and closed-source. AliasVault is fully open-source - both client and server code are publicly available. This means complete transparency and the ability to audit every line of code that handles your sensitive data.

selfHosting.title: Full Self-hosting Control
selfHosting.description: Proton Pass cannot be self-hosted, meaning you're always dependent on their infrastructure. While AliasVault too offers a convenient and secure cloud-based version, it also provides complete self-hosting capabilities with an easy installation script. With AliasVault, you are in control and can choose where to host your data.

emailAlias.title: All-In-One Password Manager
emailAlias.description: AliasVault combines password management with email alias and identity generation capabilities in one secure platform. Create disposable email addresses on the fly including fictive first name, last name, birthdate etc., providing enhanced privacy and convenience. All of this without any third-party dependencies and fully open-source.

transparency.title: The Importance of Full Transparency
transparency.description: When it comes to password managers, transparency is crucial for trust:

codeAudit.title: Complete Code Audit:
codeAudit.description: With AliasVault, you can audit every line of code that handles your passwords, including server-side logic that Proton Pass keeps closed-source.

noBackdoors.title: No Hidden Backdoors:
noBackdoors.description: Full open-source transparency means there are no hidden features or backdoors that could compromise your security.

communityVerification.title: Community Verification:
communityVerification.description: The open-source nature allows security researchers and the community to continuously review and improve the codebase.

selfHostingControl.title: Self-hosting Control:
selfHostingControl.description: Run your own instance and have complete control over your data, eliminating dependency on third-party infrastructure.

limitations.title: Good to Know
limitations.description: In the spirit of transparency, here are some current limitations of AliasVault compared to Proton Pass:

brandRecognition.title: Brand Recognition:
brandRecognition.description: Proton has a well-established brand and larger user base, which may provide more community support and integrations.

ecosystemIntegration.title: Ecosystem Integration:
ecosystemIntegration.description: Proton Pass integrates with other Proton services (Mail, VPN, etc.) if you're already in their ecosystem.
